column1: outside off, pushed into the covers
on the toes, tucked to the leg side
that's a lovely ball, angling in and nipping away, past the left-hander's edge. Warner does well not to nick it
dangling it outside off stump, tempting the indiscretion. Warner leaves
tight and straight, tapped back to the bowler. Hitting the pitch hard on a fullish length, and just nibbling it a touch so far
round the wicket, angled into the bat, poked to cover and that's a maiden. Well done.
careful now! A wild slash outside off, desperate to feel bat on ball
dangled outside off, a hint of gentle outswing. Finch reaches but can't connect
good line and length, a bit of outswing once more. Finch leaves alone, as the ball dies through to the keeper
wafty. Finch is lining up the massive wallop over the covers, but Wood's line keeps drifting just out of his reach
fuller length, Finch attempts to hit straight back whence it came, but a thick outside edge fizzes into the covers to get him off the mark
on the back foot, punched back down the pitch. 'Wait on!' is the cry, and sure enough, they wait. Very solid start
biffed! On the front foot, dispatched with utter contempt through mid-on with a round-house swing. That'll make him feel better!
good comeback, tighter line. Defended
another boundary, not remotely where he intended, but his ambitious swing means that an attempted cover-drive ends up as a whistling inside edge through midwicket
hanging back in the crease this time, a single into the leg side
lots of humpty behind that stroke, cracked on the up into the covers. But wide mid-off is well placed
a quick single to backward point, Roy fumbles as Warner gets off the mark

a fraction too short, and now it's Warner's turn to connect with a haymaker, leaning back to smite with great vengeance over wide mid-on. Seems he's knocked the ball a touch out of shape with that blow
short again, Warner rises onto his toes, like a pugnacious ballerina, and hauls a measured pull through the leg-side
better line and length, holding its own on off stump. Finch pats back to the bowler
on the back foot, and defended back down the pitch
tip and run, on the back foot, but an instant call beats the cover fielder
nibbles back into the left-hander, dabbed into the off side. Good cut and thrust on show so far
angled in from wider on the crease, defended on the back foot
sliding down the leg side
works the single
dispatched! Round the wicket, in Warner's slot, a massive heave-ho over the leg side
back on a fuller length, patted into the covers
inside edge, and tapped down into the crease. More good calling to steal the single
excellent running again, poked to the off side, an instant call. Had to scamper as the under-arm came in from Morgan but safely home
banged in short, swivelled round the corner for a measured single
a loud roar of 'no!' from the big man
on the pads, that's a poor ball, and Rashid can't cut that off as Warner works it exceptionally fine off the hip
tapped to the leg side
well bowled, fuller length, swinging past a tentative poke outside off
tries to steal the single into the off side, think better of it, then nick it anyway as the shy pings off the stumps and away to no-man's land. Excellent awareness from Australia
round the wicket, that's a probing line and length, pushed back down the pitch from under the batsman's nose
up on the toes, working the single to the leg side
good placement from Finch, this is a positive start from Australia, without being explosive
deflected fine
inches from holing out to cover! Pushed hard off the back foot, it hung in the air for a while, but died just in front
a good bombastic finish to another over of solid progress. Short, not ruinously so, but Warner is so quick to punish on length. Midwicket can't intercept
on the pads, another single to keep England frustrated

edged and Warner is gone! That is a superb delivery from Wood, inch-perfect line, kicking off the deck and nibbling half-a-bat's width away from the left-hander! He was just beginning to find his range, but Australia's danger man is extracted in his prime
lovely way to greet the new batsman! Outside off, holds its line, beats a tentative defensive push
well bowled again, outside off, a hint of movement back into the right hander, as he shoulders arms
firm-handed push to cover. 'No run!' is the cry, but then Morgan misfields, so they take one anyway
that's a loose delivery, too straight to a player of Finch's ability, who walks inside the line and tucks a boundary through fine leg
no stroke offered as the ball crashes into the pads! Huge appeal from Ball, but he knows in his heart of hearts that that was missing off... no review, on we go
sharp lift from a full length, Smith removes his top hand from the bat as the ball gets big on him
good forcing stroke off the back foot, bisecting cover and point, who chase manfully to the edge of the rope to limit the damage
outside off, through to the keeper on a measured line and length
beautiful timing, trusting the hands to fling the ball through the line and away to the rope
panned down the pitch once again. He's finding the middle of his bat already
driving with hard hands off the back foot, not really timed though as it pings off the splice into the off side
through to the keeper once more
on the toes, into the leg side
punched into the covers, Smith feels the vibrations through his handle as he wrings his top hand after that shot
wider on the crease from Wood, fuller length as well. Cover tidies up
tight line, tight length. Defended into the off side from deep in the crease
tremendous strike! Full and straight, Finch waited and waited, bashed it right under his eyeline, and it squeezes past the stumps and away to the rope
works the single as Plunkett adjusts his length
on the pads, flicked wide of mid-on, who gathers with a dive
slower ball, but Finch picks it well, waiting late to punch it past a flailing mid-on. A loose start from Plunkett
drilled on the up, into the covers
on the pads, settles for a deflected single into the leg side
a bit of a loosener, short and wide, but cover is well placed to protect against any damage
tighter line, back of a length, punched to mid-off
on the pads, tapped to midwicket
cracked into the off side, no way through
worked off the leg side
slower ball, back of a length, pulled to backward square. A tidier over from Stokes
attacking the toes, worked to leg
that's Plunkett's area, tight on off stump, hitting the deck hard, forcing a defensive push off the back foot
ambitious from Smith, looking to steal a single to a non-descript push to mid-on, and he had to scarper for his crease as the under-arm flick came in
misdirected. We'll have that one again
whittled into the leg side, full length on the pads
pushed back into the crease, defended to the leg side
a better over from Plunkett, he's finding his range
very full length once again, drilled to mid-on
outside off stump, dangled out there, asking Finch to come and have a go. He declines, and simply wafts the ball back to the bowler with minimal footwork
tapped to cover, another sharp single
a wide line and a full length. Stokes inviting Smith to take the initiative
short, and that's a cracking stroke - literally, as the shot echoes around a disappointingly un-rammed Edgbaston. But the midwicket sweeper tidies up
short and wide, but the sweeper on the off side this time is well placed to intercept
thumped out to the off side
full length, and defended to the off side
outside off, tight line, full length, left alone
tucked up a touch by a tighter line. Plunkett gathers in his followthrough
fenced down into the crease
that's a good bit of dot-joining from Plunkett, tight on off stump and fended away
a cross-seam delivery from Stokes, but it comes out as a bit of a biff-able long-hop, slapped through midwicket
back-to-back boundaries, as Stokes is this time punished for his wider line. Cut fiercely
Stokes recalibrates, and this is a better ball angling into the top of off. Pushed to point
genuine edge, but Buttler can't reach it! A loose waft, but safe in the end, as England's only slip is standing at a splice-intercepting fifth
shorter and straighter, tucked to the leg side. The fifty partnership is up in good time
a touch taken aback as this one leaps from a good length. But negotiated in the end
tight line outside off, Smith hops across to work into the leg side
squirted into the leg side, another single to keep the pot boiling
a roll of the wrists, and a single to midwicket. Fifty for Finch, and he's building a head of steam
attacking line
Smith opens the face on impact, attempting to milk a tight and aggressive line on off stump
worked into the leg side, another single - lots of them around today.
floated up full on off stump, blunted watchfully back to the bowler by Smith
full and loopy, comes across, tapped into the covers
flighted, bit of dip on to middle stump, Smith clips it brusquely past the bowler and Jake Ball has to put in a good slide to stop it at long-on
tossed up on the legs and worked away square for a single
full and flighted, nurdled to mid-on, the fielder is set back and it's a comfortable single
pushed through a bit quicker on the stumps, Smith tucks to midwicket for one more
oof, that's a menace, Plunkett beams Smith and it's rightly called a no-ball, did well to shovel it away to leg for a couple
follows up with a bouncer that Smith swivels down to fine leg
length on the hips and tucked into a gap square, they come back for two
sliding in with the arm, Finch waits in the crease and turns one more off his hip
lovely stroke, timed like a Swiss watchmaker back down the ground, beats mid-on and races away
back of a length and worked into the leg side
short outside off stump, Finch splunks a back-foot drive square for one more
tossed up outside off and pushed down the ground to long-off
drifting a touch straighter, Smith clips it from under his nose through the on side
doesn't pick the googly, spins on to the pads but slightly leg side
huge appeal from Rashid, again he inveigles a Bosie back inside the bat, Dharmasena not interested... and England decide not to review on Buttler's instinct that is was sliding down
another lbw shout, this time as the ball grubs on to hit the boot with Finch in an awful tangle - but this was definitely missing leg
waits and calmly nudges away a single to leg to finish an eventful over
touch short and wide and steered through point for a single
lets this one go in the channel
full and wide, that's pretty ordinary bowling, Smith happily clubs it away through backward point for a boundary
better lines, Smith shuffles across and defends
short outside off, 138kph/86mph, again patted back down towards the bowler
full and wide, in the tramlines and Smith couldn't reach it having moved across. Stokes scowls at the decision
touch short and flicked off the body through backward square
flighted, on middle and leg, punched down the ground
tossed up on the stumps and Finch is down early, gets a good stride and paddles a couple through backward square
slider, this skips on and does for Finch, stuck on the back foot, into the pads, Rashid again implores for the lbw... but no dice, possibly just missing leg
spots the googly this time and plays with the spin through square leg for a couple
comes forward and pushes one back past the bowler
tossed up and tickled through mid-off for one more
on the stumps, worked away to leg
absolutely boshed! Too full from Stokes and Finch leans his considerable bulk into a hammer blow past the dive of mid-off
fired into the tramlines outside off, another wide
short, on the body and worked away to the leg side
back of a length and angling in, turned behind square but fine leg is up quickly to prevent a second

Finch misfires! Just as he was beginning to look very dangerous, he tried to launch Stokes into West Bromwich and ended up hitting the ball straight up, to be taken smartly by Morgan circling under it from mid-off. Came right off the toe of the bat, maybe deceived by a legcutter from Stokes
comes across on off and defends
tossed up on middle and leg, Henriques is on to the front foot to push away
pushed into the off side
floated up outside off, tapped towards extra cover
pushed through a little flatter and Henriques misses out trying to cut, finds backward point
floated up full and straight, worked to midwicket this time
that's a maiden for Rashid, as Henriques flays a drive to cover. Sound and fury, signifying nothing
angled in, touch short and worked away off the body through midwicket
fuller length, Henriques closes the face early and gets a leading edge back to the bowler
lovely shot, a confidence-boosting way to get off the mark, steps out and drills a square drive to the boundary, textbook shot-making
four more, this time on the pull! Henriques was waiting for it in the crease and he rolls the wrists on a whipcrack blow through backward square leg
shortish, sliding on to the body as Henriques looks to work to leg, deflects off the thigh pad
Smith is again left flailing as Stokes finds the tramlines
better line, length ball outside off, draws him forward and clips the inside edge on to pad as Smith feels for it
nicely bowled, brings the wrong'un back in and again it's inside edge on to pad as Henriques pushes forward
tossed up and this time the stroke is played more confidently, punched down the ground and they get two
flighted, on middle and leg, down early to paddle one
Smith steps out and drives a single to long-on
floated up outside off stump, Henriques taps one more back through mid-off
tossed up and tickled to long-off once again
shortish on off stump, defended back down the track
angled in and worked to leg as Smith makes a familiar journey across his stumps
back of a length outside off, Henriques opens the face and glides one to third man
length ball, clipped through midwicket
Henriques is doggedly taking on the h8terz here, steps out and pumps a half-volley past extra cover with a flourish
shortish, defended into the ground towards gully and there's no run
tossed up outside off, pushed back towards the bowler
pushed through on the stumps and flicked across the line
flighted, outside off stump, tapped into the covers

gone, slogged to mid-on! He's played a few impressive strokes - but that won't go down as one of them. Might have been the googly from Rashid but, either way, Henriques wasn't to the pitch trying to hit down the ground and it screwed off the inside half of the bat, looping tamely to mid-on
flighted, straightening on the stumps, worked away through the leg side
flat legbreak, Smith moves on to off stump and works away against the turn
shortish in the channel and Smith can't work this to leg, defends
short and a touch wide and this time Smith goes through backward point for a single
back of a length and defended from the crease
only a touch short and wide but Head plays this beautifully, arrowing a back cut to the rope at deep backward point
well bowled in response, cross-seam from Plunkett and it leaps from a shortish length to hit the glove, doesn't carry to slip
pitched up and driven, not out of the middle but he gets it past extra cover for a couple
flighted, dipping and turning on off stump, Smith leans into a block
pushed through flatter and dabbed into the off side
tossed up on middle and off stump, Smith smothers it again
bit of width, Smith cracks a drive off the back foot but finds the man at cover
tossed up on off stump, pushed down the ground for one
full and flighted, on off stump, drilled past the bowler but mid-off prevents more than a single
back of a length, worked into the leg side
banged in halfway down and Head is quickly on the pull, smacked to deep backward square

that's his fifty, overpitched and driven, wide of mid-off and it just keeps picking up pace, duping Wood into trying to cut it off and then giving him no chance - important innings from the Australia captain
goes back and across and works to the leg side
pitched up and prodded towards extra cover
dug in short and Smith whirls his arms on a flat pull to deep backward square leg
over the wicket, pushed through and it keeps a little low, Smith manages to jab it away
tossed up on off stump and defended
flighted, comes forward to drive, straight back to the bowler
pushed through on the stumps and worked to leg with the spin
round the wicket, tossed up outside off, driven to long-off coming forwards
on the stumps, Smith clips another single down the ground

gottim, plinked to mid-off! Huge wicket for England, Smith hangs his head in disgust, a really soft way to go, maybe he was expecting something quicker to start off with but instead wafts at an 85mph loosener and sends it looping slowly, tantalisingly, irresistibly to the man on the edge of the ring
shortish outside off and defended down safely
shuffles across on off stump and defends to the on side
banged in, short ball over the stumps, Maxwell ducks it
good length, 144kph/89mph and in the channel outside off, Maxwell thrusts his front leg out and leaves
fullish, tailing in and punched to mid-on - that's wicket maiden for Wood, another key intervention
round the wicket, angled in and punched back to the bowler
tossed up and defended coming forwards
gives it a bit of air, Head leans into a crisp drive but picks out extra cover
pushed through, Head drops back on off, swats a cut through cover point for one
angled in and turning down the leg side
floated up on middle and leg, Maxwell works it towards mid-on
quicker on off stump and Maxwell can only turn to midwicket - another tight over and Edgbaston drinks it in
round the wicket, banged into the deck, flashed into the off side
fended away
full length, angling into the left-hander, cramped for room and shovelled into the off side
full and tight, punched to mid-off
off the mark with his ninth delivery, finds the gap in the covers with a compact drive
edged, and so close! Turned inside-out by a genuine wicket-taking ripper, climbing into the splice and bursting out of the reach of Root at first slip. A near-replica of the Warner wicket-ball
looped up and deflects away
looking to be aggressive, firmly struck right under the eyeline
right on the money
lots of oohs as this one is dabbed out to point
flicked off the toes, just another single to deep midwicket. England have drawn the sting for the moment
a slow-turning offbreak, read off the pitch, and slapped into the covers
good delivery, nibbling off the seam and tucking up the right-hander. A deflection into the off side
round the wicket, just a notch too short, and firmly spanked out to wide long-on
deflected into the leg side, working with the round-the-wicket angle
on the pads, flipped through square leg
looking for power over placement. Loses his shape in the progress
on the pads, worked into the leg side. England controlling the tempo well for now
crashed through the covers with power and intent, but that's a stunning piece of fielding, pouncing on a scurrying ball with the grace and accuracy of a housecat
worked off the hip
reverse sweep, under-edged into the crease.
powered through the ring this time. Simple and effective
looking to work into the leg side again
back and across, cracked on the up out to deep cover
round the wicket, Head wanders across his stumps to work with the angle of a leg-side delivery
a monstrous wind-up and, well, good intent, but he misses that one by a mile. Just as well for the neighbouring houses
tucked square
good placement
working the single to keep the score ticking
open-faced deflection through third man, as the floodlights blink into life
looking for a hack over cover, a thick outside-edge flies through point
firmly bunted through the line, takes the single to mid-on
crashing cut. No sweeper in place due to Maxwell's penchant for the sweep. That fizzes through the gap
hauled into the leg side, a bit of sharp turn on display there
wafted back over the bowler's head. Decent connection from deep in the crease, but was aiming squarer
good bit of footwork lures a wide down the leg-side
crunched square but straight to the fielder. A kick of the bat in frustration as he misses out on what he must have thought was a boundary-ball. Ten to go
flicked away
Maxwell is signalling his frustration as another ball goes by without any rope-clearing
tucked up on the legs, but that's more like it for Australia. Lightning hands through the ball, despite being cramped for room, and square leg can't intercept
a tennis-smash, and it's two in two! Flashed in front of square as Ball drops short. Well played
good riposte, comes over the wicket for a change of angle, aims straight, offering no room to free the arms
flipped to leg, more good connection  but only to the midwicket sweeper
a loose full toss, spanked through Morgans hands in the covers. That was travelling, but he took the sting off it
well bowled, looped up and twisting off the pitch past a flat-footed waft
on the toes, square leg cuts it off
keeps a touch low outside off, as Head has a swing across the line for another single to midwicket
flogged into the off side
cut out to deep point
dropped! So nearly Wood striking twice with the first ball of the spell ... and a run-out chance too, but he's safely home at the non-striker's end. Flogged fiercely to cover, and down it goes!
outside off, beats  a loose waft

caught in the deep! Brilliant from Roy! Short ball from Wood, hit hard and flat, it's six all the way, but round swoops Roy, plucking the ball above his head, foot a millimetre from the line, then in that now-typical-but-still-awesome manner, tosses the ball up as his momentum takes him over, then gathering when back in play. Stunning. The umpires are checking, but this looks clean... Roy certainly thought so, and so does the third umpire!
on the toes, tucked to leg
tight line to the left-hander, dabbed to the off side
worked off the pads, swiftly back for two as the sweeper hurtles in. Another mightily effective over from Wood
poked into the off side, a touch airborne
outside the off stump, punched on the up to cover

googly! Wades reads it about as well as I can read Hindi. Three fielders converge but Rashid calls for his own catch as the ball loops straight up in the air, and England are really taking control in the slog-overs now
looped up, and driven to short cover
lovely line and length, every ball a hand-grenade

that's terrible! An attempted googly, comes out as a leg-stump full toss, Starc slaps across the line as if substituting his bat for a damp tuna-fish, and up loops another facile catch, this time for Root behind the stumps!
a lot resting on Head now as he nudges another single
a slip in place as Wood hammers out a threatening length, but deflected away,
tries to climb into a leg-side hoick but Wood is too sharp for him
full length, almost a low full toss, toe-ended back to the bowler in his followthrough
on the hip, flipped into the leg-side
good pace, good length, nothing for Australia to work with at all
forward and nudged into the leg side
a touch more width as Rashid drags it short, but Head settles for a single with a cut to point
on the pads, and swept fine. Good quick running
steered straight to short cover. Australia finding it tough to get any momentum
oh, well bowled. Drops the pace right down, the ball dips late and spins sharply past a loose wafty drive

too easy for Rashid, who finishes his spell with a four-for! A lollipop push straight back to the bowler, neither forward nor back, and utterly unsure of which direction that would spin. England are rampant!
banged in short, a calm pull through backward square to bring up a battling fifty from Head. He needs to be there for the full 50 now
forward and crunched to mid-off
onto the front foot, can't get that away
full toss, and bowled! Zampa didn't fancy staying in line one little bit, gave himself room, and was in no position to protect his timbers as Wood splattered his off pole!
full length, oohs and aahs ring out as Australia's No.11 survives
pushed back onto the crease, blocked down into leg side
round the wicket, Head sensibly lets this go and the umpire stretches his arms
down the track, a bit of a dirty hack across the line, looking for midwicket, but finding cover with a mistimed splat-shot
forward and punched to cover
round the wicket, angling into the left-hander. Punched to cover
outside off, and cut through point
yee-har! Down on one knee in the sort of impetuous will-you-marry-me pose last seen in Elvis's Chapel in Vegas. The answer's no, as it happens
more circumspect this time, takes the single, keeps the strike
great line and length, another valiant thrash, but the ball hops over the stroke and the stumps
hacked in the air, can Wood reach it at third man? No, not quite!
short, forcing Head to take on the long boundary, and this time, he does so to mighty effect! Stokes thought he was in business, into the wind, but just too much power!
punched down to long-off. Declines the single with two still to come
ha, a comically slow slower-ball! Head was walking down the pitch, but the bouncer barely reached him as he flailed to make contact
tucks the single to leg, to keep the strike. One massive six, but just seven from the over
spanked over midwicket! That's brilliant from Head, the best contact of the night, absolutely whistles over the fielder. Not the right line from Stokes though, feeding his strengths
better length, a spiralling top-edge to cover, now, who wants this? It's Plunkett ... but it's dropped! He was late to react, and never quite reached it
edged, and safe! Invaluable runs for Australia, to keep their tournament hopes alive
a baseball biff back through the line of the ball. Stokes sticks out a hand to limit the damage
width, and cracked down the ground, straight to long off. Good contact, but too straight

hacked into the leg side, and that's some ropey fielding at midwicket to allow them to get back for two. Well played Travis Head, his defiant biffing has given Australia a toe-hold in a must-win game.
starts with a full toss outside off and Roy connects pretty sweetly to send it fine of mid-off for four first ball

struck in front, Roy in a tangle... and after an age to think about it, Kumar Dharmasena raises his finger! Roy doesn't consult with his partner but quickly requests a review, but straight away this looks optimistic; no bat, hit on the knee, did it pitch outside leg? NO! Another single-figure score for Roy, his horror run continues and Starc makes an immediate incision into the England batting. GAME ON!!
very full, sliding down the leg side, Root skelps it down to fine leg for one
pitched up, around off stump, 141kph/88mph and Hales gets in behind it to block to cover
full outside off, no swing for Starc and Hales stays still and belts it straight to extra cover
full again and met on the front foot, defended to the off side
full, nibbly length, wants the pitch to help him out, bit of a leading edge on Root's prod but it beats cover and runs for one

got him, nicked to slip! Hazlewood finds the perfect either-or length, hits the seam around off stump and Hales is frozen in position as he pushes tentatively, gets a big, thick edge and it loops to first where Finch clasps it low down
full, angled across in the channel, Morgan watches it through
tighter line, Morgan steps forward on off stump and shows it a straight bat in defence
rising from slightly back of a length, 137kph/85mph in the channel, left alone
touch short, angled across and again there's no stroke
pitched up and pushed square on the off side coming forwards
in the channel, length ball but no swing and Root leaves it be
tight lines around off and Root leans into a solid block
pitched up, beginning to tail back in as Root clears his feet out of the way and clips towards mid-on
crisply struck, Root's first shot in anger, gets his weight coming forwards and lasers four through point
slanted across the bows, touch wide and not coming back in, Root shoulders arms
back of a length around off stump, steered to point
skips down, trying to disrupt Hazlewood, turns the length into a half-volley and although it is 143kph/89mph he just uses that to his advantage, hammering his first boundary through the covers
now Hazlewood drops short but there's width and Morgan is back to slash hard in front of square for four more
slightly short and wide again and Morgan cracks it hard but straight to the man at cover
round the wicket, overpitched and that is a sweet straight drive, leans on a push and it races away past mid-on to the rope for a third boundary in the over

dropped! Hazlewood goes short, down the leg side and Morgan gets something on it - but Wade can't hold on diving full stretch to his right and it runs towards fine leg for a couple more. He went for it one-handed when two might have been better
edged but short this time! Four more to the England cause, Root was feeling for it without foot movement but the nick landed short of the the cordon and flew between first and second slip
pitched up and this time Root gets a clean connection, driven with better footwork although it won't quite go all the way
Starc stays over the wicket, good length around fourth stump, defended
puts it on a length, holding its line around off, softly blocked
fuller, in the channel, Morgan swings his axe and chops the ball to point on the bounce
full, fast and furious, 147kph/92mph but wide of the stumps and Morgan latches on to the square drive, again Maxwell at backward point cuts it off
touch too full and straight, whipped off the pads, Head misfields at midwicket and they runs a couple
good ball, rising from a length in the channel, past the outside edge as Root prods on the back foot
moves down the pitch, flicks to leg and it diverts away fine, Hazlewood appeals but Gaffaney isn't interested

gone, the outside edge this time snapped up by Wade! Another big breakthrough, Hazlewood clenches his fists as Root departs, more excellent line bowling and it nipped to kiss the edge, a simple catch for the keeper this time
an lbw appeal first ball, Stokes trapped on the crease, thudding into the knee roll...! Gaffaney shakes his head, looked like it pitched outside leg
length ball on middle and off, defended off the inside half of the bat
full and wide and crunched unceremoniously through point by Morgan to get us restarted with a boundary, much to the delight of the crowd
four more, another half-volley and this is eased in front of square coming forwards! Morgan back up and running straight away
shortens his length outside off, tapped down towards point
back of a length, good pace and flying through at chest height as Morgan drops the hands
drops short, this is a bit of long-hop but Morgan is slightly late on it and misses with a cut
shortish in the channel outside off and guided down to third man on the back foot
floated up wide of the stumps and Morgan throws the hands gaily through the line once again, it's in the air but flies between backward point and cover point and runs away
angled across in the corridor, Morgan is pretty certain about leaving
length ball, Morgan goes hard at it and gets a couple off a thick inside edge to fine leg
pitched up and this is just eased back past the bowler, check-driven as Stokes comes forward and holds his momentum for a couple
length, on the stumps and worked into the leg side
pushed towards off stump, dabbed down into the covers
comes across on off and punches to mid-off
length ball, 142kph/88mph, pushed square on the off side
full on off stump, even quicker from Cummins, 146kph and stroked towards mid-off
banged in short and climbing through above the crouching Morgan
shortish outside off and Morgan goes back to cut, sends it to backward point. Tight stuff from Cummins so far
back of a length and rising over off, no width on offer and it's defended back to the bowler - maiden to begin with from Patty C
length ball around off stump, Stokes presses forward and defends
shortish, comes off the inside of the bat and runs to midwicket
swings across the line and turns a single into the leg side
dug in short and Morgan dumps the ball into the crowd! Always worth testing him with the short ball but Morgan is seeing it like Bravestarr (eyes of the hawk) and swings it up and away over the rope
comes across and taps this one down into the off side
back of a length outside off, defended towards cover
length ball on the stumps, worked towards midwicket
good pace from Cummins, 146kph/91mph but flicked comfortably wide of fine leg for a couple, first runs he has conceded
what a shot that is, a touch leg side but Stokes times is beautifully as he swings to leg and sends it fizzing past midwicket for four
more runs, Cummins drops short and Stokes takes on the pull, big top edge but it flies fine of the man down there and elicits more jollity from a packed house
angled across and Stokes spears a drive through cover point
dug in, climbing towards shoulder height as Morgan drops back and gets on top of it in defence
on the pads, Stokes clips it out to deep backward square leg for one
back of a length and defended around off stump
banged in short again, this time Morgan swings it h-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-g-h over fine leg, bit top-edgey but it flies a dozen rows back into the stands
angled across and tapped towards cover from the crease
shortish, fractionally wide and there's room to bring the hands up and cut one through point
fuller and punched back down the track, Hazlewood gets a hand on it in his follow through
pushed across the bows and dabbed down to third man for one
slightly full, 145kph/90mph on middle and leg, Stokes pushes cautiously towards mid-on
pitched up around fourth stump, Stokes leans into a drive to the cover sweeper
pitched up and driven again, out to Finch in the deep
beautiful batting, gets half a stride and pings it on the up, middled straight back down the ground for four
more entertainment for the crowd as Starc misfields a drive on the greasy surface at mid-off and Stokes picks up a brace
very full, dips and nearly sneaks under the bat as Morgan chops down on it
tossed up and dinked through the covers coming forwards
flighted, drifting towards the pads, turned to midwicket
pushed through, Stokes goes back and hurls the bat at a cut, finds cover
flicked through backward square leg, a full toss from Head and Stokes helps it away to the boundary
pushed through on off, tapped square
short and wide and Morgan cuts fiercely off the back foot down to third man
pitched up and Stokes slashes hard, off the outside edge but it whistles over the leaping Maxwell at backward point. Scorched!
fullish, Stokes swings from the hip again, mistimed into the covers
full toss from Cummins and that is humped away over the leg side, just needs to get a good connection on it and the screw turns tighter - England's 100 up and they have come roaring back at Australia
pitched up, Stokes drive, in the air... but just short of cover diving forwards
round the wicket, full and wide and lashed to the fence once again! Stokes has muscles on his muscles and looks in imperious mood
tossed up from round the wicket, miscued back towards the bowler
flighted, leans forward and strokes one through the covers
Stokes comes down and clips though mid-on
comes across and pushes this towards cover
tossed up on the stumps and worked down the ground
tossed up and clipped to long-on for another single to end the over
short outside off, Stokes advances and swings vengefully, fails to connect
pitched up and prodded into the covers coming forwards
fourth-stump line, 126kph dobbers, Stokes pushes into the covers and is sent back
dug in short and lollipopping up outside off, Stokes drags a pull down past midwicket for a couple
steps out to drive, in the air... but it clears mid-on! More tap from Stokes and he swings though the line
in the channel, opens the face and steers to backward point
short of a length, over middle and leg, Morgan chops it down towards midwicket
outside off, Morgan waits and pushes in front of point for one
good length, 146kph/90mph and tapped back on the move, Starc sticks out a paw to stop it
comes forward and punches firmly to mid-on
tonked beyond the rope at deep backward square, that's his fifty! Banged in shot by Starc but Stokes likes it that way and goes hard in response, hooked for six!
better length, worked off the pads to midwicket
over the wicket, tossed up on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
pushed through and worked off the legs behind square for a single
looped up on off, Stokes prods it into a gap in the covers and they scamper one
full and clipped down the ground coming forwards - that's Morgan's fifty, too, a firefighting knock to get England back in this game
floated up on the stumps and tapped away
fizzed through, Stokes closes the face and works to midwicket
pitched up and sporked towards point without timing
full and Morgan drives, comes off the outside half of the bat and loops past extra cover, lands wide of mid-off and they get one
fired in straight, nudged to midwicket
fullish outside off, 146kph and poked into the covers coming forwards
low full toss, whipped crisply off the pads out to deep midwicket... The crowd gives Finch the wind-up as he fields
full, 145kph/90mph on off, Morgan chops down in it - which means we have played 20 overs and Australia cannot have another no-result
stoutly forward
a wild slash - and why not? - but safely into the covers
more compact drive, nice high elbow
stabbed through mid-off, a loose dive allows another run
short, wide, crash. Gave himself room, slammed his bat through the line, and cover had no chance whatsoever
better line and length, twisting into a back-foot push back to the bowler
ab-so-lute-lee massive! Short, ugly delivery, sat up and begged to be flogged into the stands!
into line
better line and length, clipped to leg
forward and blocked
a lot of excitement round the bat, but nothing doing as Morgan works this one to leg
standing tall on the back foot. Content to play out the over after that beast of a shot early doors
pushed off the back foot to mid-on
reverse sweep, that's sweetly played, toying with the field and just pickpocketing the boundary through third man
tapped to mid-on
a misfield from Zampa off his own bowling. It's getting ragged out there
better ball, holding its line on leg stump, but fended away
down the track, Zampa saw him coming, dropped it a touch short, and nearly a return catch. But nearly doesn't cut it right now for Australia...
tapped into the off side
short, Stokes rocks back but doesn't connect properly. Driver error might be Australia's best hope here
forward and pushed to mid-off
on the pads, tucked to leg
cut to point
absolutely pounded once again, high over wide long-on. Australia's part-time spin approach is playing into England's hands, and wrists, and flailing bats at the moment
nudged down to long-on
sliding down the leg side
on the hip, one more single to backward square
hammered hard through long-on! 'Catch catch!' is the cry, but my God that's got some power on it. Scuds flat over Warner's head and into the stands!
back on a better length
wafted down to long-on to rotate the strike again
looped up, calm response from Morgan, who steps forward to milk the single to long-on. Australia can't attack, and can't defend in their current mindset. They simply have to get a wicket soon
smashed through point, Morgan gauging the change-up in pace from the outset
that is stunning timing! A nothing flick from back of a length, into the leg-side to a decent delivery, but that just seems to pick up speed as it gallops through wide long-on
down on one knee, flashy drive into the covers
fuller length, a circumspect push through the line
another down-on-one-knee drill into the covers
wider of the stumps, flashed in the air, down to third man
full length, an outside-edged push to point
on to the front foot
forward to defend
onto the front foot once more, steering the ball back down the pitch
back of a length, chiselled into the leg side
on the hip, worked to deep midwicket for another single, as England wisely decide to show respect to Australia's wicket threats
good wheels from Cummins, that's through Stokes before he can lay bat on ball, at 91mph
high-elbowed push back down the line of the ball. An urgent single
bouncer, and Morgan has a hoick, but can't get close to it
short, wide, cut. Clean through point. Golly, he's timed that shot well today
down the track to defend into the covers
crashed through the off side once again. The sweeper cleans up, but Australia's prospects continue to ebb away
pushed down the ground
stands tall in defence, poked to the off side
murderous intent as Stokes advances and batters a drive into the covers, where a fine diving stop limits the damage
on the pads, a deft clip to deep midwicket.
huge. Simply huge. A round-house bottom-handed dump-truck of a shot, down the track, into the stands!
behind the line this time
forward and blocked down the track
up comes the 150 partnership with another cherry-picked pair of runs
tight line and length
very full length, tapped into the off side
very full once again, chiselled into the leg side. No joy for Australia. Plenty, it would seem, for Bangladesh ...
wow, timing to the fore. Clearing the front leg, swinging the bat through the line, the ball streaks through cover
on the pads, worked to leg
worked to leg
dabbed to the off side
pushed a touch wider, and a rare play-and-miss
fuller length, attacking the stumps. Worked to point to complete the over
forward and wafted into the leg side
nudged into the leg side. Easy pickings
tight line and length, blocked back down the pitch
into line to defend. No rush here for England. Utter control now. Can Australia disrupt them somehow?

there's the disruption! A chip in the air from Stokes, inches short of midwicket. Morgan is ball-watching as Stokes hurtles for a single, and that's an immense direct hit shy from Zampa with the skipper stranded!
full toss to greet the new batsman. Worked down to third man
solidly onto the front foot, blocked back down the pitch
forward and pushed to cover
worked to leg
on the back foot, punching out to cover
tight line and length
down on one knee, swept calmly for the single
round the wicket from Starc, but that's right in Buttler's arc, laced along the turf through the covers, bottom-handed to oblivion
angled into the right-hander from round the wicket, Buttler waits til the ball is under his eyeline, then dabs a single to cover
into line to defend
squeezed into the leg side, another cheer goes up for the single. Edgbaston is enjoying itself today
firmly into line, good attacking delivery, probing the stumps from round the wicket
another nudge into the covers
works the single once again, Australia can't have fielders everywhere
stands tall in defence, and that's a well-taken single, the ball just bobbling into the off side. Buttler was actually slow setting off, but Stokes' judgment was correct
worked into the covers once more, a ripple of applause for another pair of runs milked
blocked into the covers. A productive area with the field set deep. Australia dying a death by a thousand cuts here.
on the back foot, punched on the up into the leg side
behind the line once more
back of a length, cut loosely to point and dropped by Maxwell! He lost sight of it as it burst out of the crowd, and goes clean through him as well! Oh dear
stabbed to point, a huge ironic cheer echoes out as Maxwell fields more successfully this time
another stolen single into the covers
pushed on the up, to mid-on
another stab into the off side, another single
pushed to mid-off, Starc's day is done, and with him goes one of Australia's most potent wicket-taking threats. Where now for Smith?
pushed into the off side
long hop. Stokes dances at the crease, waits for the ball to pitch and spin, then flogs it hard through the covers to move into the nineties
a touch slower, a touch wider
open-faced push down the ground to long-on
could this be the breakthrough? A loose slap down the ground, but no! It bounces short of the fielder, clatters off his shins, and away to the rope. Oh misery...
into line, defended
pulled from back of a length, out through square leg
short, pulled, but Buttler plays an air shot as the ball hops through to the keeper
a whistling bouncer, Buttler dips out of a pull. Gets away with the wide on height
tapped past point. Another cheer in the stands, though that may a Mexican Wave. The crowd are making their own entertainment as England just chip away
on the pads, nurdled to the midwicket sweeper
up on the toes, defended to point
on the pads, tucked behind square
down the track, fetched into the leg side, nearly done in the flight as the ball dipped late, but made good contact in the end
solid block back to the bowler
back of a length, carved to point
dispatched. Picked the line, picked the length. In the arc, and battered high and hard over long-on!
thumped back to the bowler. Australia are helpless bystanders in their own demise
hauled into the leg side
tight line, defended to the leg side
dabbed to third man
advances and smears into the off side
solid block, covering the stumps with a big stride
on the pads, worked to the leg side

slammed in front  of deep cover, that's his hundred! Magnificent stuff from Stokes, though this was a straightforward dispatch of a long-hop through the covers... Off comes the helmet, up go the crowd, England are powering to their target
pushed through on the stumps and tucked to leg
